title: December 16, 2025 - January 7, 2026
summary: WAN 2.6 launches with 15-second consistency and multi-shot control, Seedance 1.5 Pro and Flux 2 Max released, Kling adds voice control, Google announces Veo 3, Billy Boman delivers P&G commercial adaptation with Media Monks, David Clark shares comprehensive Veo 3 workflow, community explores new upscaling and consistency techniques, and RealDreams HQ welcomes Stephan Bugaj, Sultan, and Andy.
keyHighlights: WAN 2.6 launches with 15-second consistency and multi-shot motion control
Seedance 1.5 Pro and Flux 2 Max released for advanced image generation
Kling adds voice control for natural language video prompting
Google officially announces Veo 3 with improved quality and control
Billy Boman delivers P&G commercial adaptation using AI workflow with Media Monks
David Clark shares comprehensive Veo 3 workflow with upscaling strategies

items.title: üé¨ WAN 2.6 Released with Multi-Shot Control
items.overview: Ludovic announces WAN 2.6 with 15-second consistency, perfect audio sync, one-prompt multi-shot control, and character/voice replication.
items.description: Ludovic announced WAN 2.6 on Wan-Video, highlighting major improvements: 15-second consistency with perfect audio sync, one-prompt multi-shot control, ability to replicate character ID and voice from 2-10 second clips with audio upload support, multi-character and cartoon support, and commercial-grade output quality. Ludovic demonstrated the capabilities with a first test showing multi-shot text-to-video generation in a single 15-second prompt, showcasing the system's ability to maintain consistency across multiple shots without manual editing.

items.title: üé• Seedance 1.5 Pro Released
items.overview: Edmond Yang and Ludovic discuss Seedance 1.5 Pro release with improved dialogue and cinematic capabilities.
items.description: Edmond Yang noted that Seedance 1.5 Pro was released, prompting immediate community testing. Ludovic shared a first test of text-to-video generation, demonstrating a single-generation cinematic scene with over-the-shoulder alternating perspectives, intimate medium close-up shots with shallow depth of field, featuring two people under a flickering streetlight in a rainy parking lot with tense spoken English dialogue. The test showcased the model's ability to handle complex prompts including specific camera angles, lighting conditions, environmental effects (rain, reflections), ambient sound design, and natural dialogue without subtitles, all in a single generation.

items.title: üñºÔ∏è Flux 2 Max Released
items.overview: Luka T announces Flux 2 Max release, noting no open weights available.
items.description: Luka T announced that Flux 2 Max was released, noting that open weights are not yet available and likely never will be. The release coincided with multiple other major model launches on the same day, prompting Winston Mayo to humorously observe how everyone thought it was safe to release on the same day, resulting in five different models launching simultaneously.

items.title: üé§ Kling Adds Voice Control in Version 2.6
items.overview: Ludovic shares Kling 2.6 release notes highlighting new voice control feature.
items.description: Ludovic announced that Kling added voice control capabilities in version 2.6, sharing the official release notes. This update allows users to control video generation using voice inputs, expanding the platform's accessibility and workflow options for creators.

items.title: üé¨ Google Announces Veo 3
items.overview: Community discusses Google's Veo 3 announcement and its implications for the industry.
items.description: The community engaged in extensive discussions about Google's announcement of Veo 3, their next-generation video model. David Clark and others analyzed the technical capabilities, workflow implications, and potential impact on professional production pipelines. The announcement generated significant interest regarding how Veo 3's improvements would compare to existing tools like Veo 2 and competing platforms.

items.title: ü§ñ Meta Announces New AI Model
items.overview: Zack Abrams shares Meta's announcement of a new AI model.
items.description: Zack Abrams shared Meta's announcement of a new AI model, adding to the wave of releases during this period. The timing of the announcement coincided with multiple other major platform updates, creating what the community jokingly referred to as a coordinated release day across the industry.

items.title: üè¢ GCSC Future Studio Event Announced for London
items.overview: Aaron Bhugobaun announces GCSC Future Studio event at Google Kings Cross office in February with open invitation.
items.description: Aaron Bhugobaun announced that another GCSC Future Studio event will be held in London at the Google Kings Cross office in February, extending an open invitation to all RealDreams HQ members. He indicated they are planning the session and encouraged anyone interested in presenting or participating to reach out. The announcement was met with enthusiasm from Ludovic, Marco, and Justin Hackney, who all expressed interest in attending.

items.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Nano Banana Pro Data Leak Incident
items.overview: Albert Bozesan and Billy Boman report cross-contamination in Nano Banana Pro generations, suggesting potential data leak.
items.description: Albert Bozesan reported receiving completely unexpected and inappropriate results from Nano Banana Pro via Freepik, including generations that appeared to be from other users' projects (skin products, women showering) while working on a 2D animation. Billy Boman confirmed experiencing similar issues on the API with lots of weirdness. Albert identified this as potentially an actual data leak rather than just generation errors. Martin Haerlin noted experiencing the same issues in the morning but reported it improved later. Jovardi reported no issues on their end, suggesting the problem was affecting specific users or regions.

items.title: üîß Claude Agentic Tasks Mode Testing
items.overview: Matthiei shares news about Anthropic testing new agentic tasks mode for Claude.
items.description: Matthiei shared an article about Anthropic testing a new agentic tasks mode for Claude, which would allow the AI to perform more complex, multi-step tasks autonomously. This development represents a significant advancement in AI agent capabilities and workflow automation.

items.title: üé® Recraft.ai Sponsorship Warning
items.overview: Robert O'Shaugnessy warns community about Recraft.ai ghosting on payment after sponsored video went live.
items.description: Robert O'Shaugnessy issued a word of caution to the community about Recraft.ai, reporting that they ghosted him on communications and payment after a sponsored video went live. He noted this rarely happens but found it most annoying. Billy Boman thanked him for sharing the experience and calling them out, while Edmond Yang expressed frustration with an angry emoji. This warning serves as an important reminder for creators to be cautious when entering sponsorship agreements.

items.title: üé¨ David Clark: Comprehensive Veo 3 Workflow
items.overview: David Clark shares detailed workflow for Veo 3 production pipeline with consistency techniques.

tutorial.workflow: David Clark detailed his comprehensive Veo 3 workflow for maintaining consistency across multi-shot productions. His approach emphasizes careful prompt engineering, character consistency techniques, and strategic use of reference images to maintain visual coherence throughout longer sequences.
key_steps: Start with detailed character descriptions and save them as reference prompts
Use consistent lighting and camera angle descriptions across all shots
Generate reference frames first before committing to full sequences
Maintain a prompt library for recurring elements (locations, characters, props)
Use Veo 3's improved consistency features to lock in character appearances
Test multiple variations before selecting the best take for each shot
tutorial.best_practices: David emphasized the importance of building a comprehensive prompt library early in the project, as this saves significant time when generating multiple shots. He also recommended generating test frames at lower quality first to verify consistency before committing to full-resolution renders.
tutorial.results: The workflow enables creators to maintain character and environmental consistency across longer narrative sequences, significantly reducing the need for manual corrections and re-generations.

items.title: üé• Billy Boman: P&G Commercial Adaptation Workflow
items.overview: Billy Boman shares detailed workflow for adapting P&G commercial using WAN for Media Monks, completed over a weekend.

tutorial.project: Billy Boman detailed a proof-of-concept project for P&G in the Middle East, working with Media Monks to adapt an existing commercial featuring a female character into a version featuring an Egyptian male celebrity. The project required taking the original commercial and running some parts through WAN while fully re-prompting other scenes to accommodate the character change.
tutorial.main_challenge: The primary challenge was that all two-shot scenes where they needed to replace a short female character with a taller male character didn't work with WAN, as the height difference created composition and framing issues that the tool couldn't properly handle.
creative_solutions: Selectively chose which scenes to run through WAN versus fully re-prompt
Developed workarounds for height difference issues in two-shot compositions
Coordinated closely with Media Monks' editing team to blend AI-generated and traditional techniques
Worked under extreme time pressure (brief received Thursday evening, delivery Monday morning)
tutorial.workflow_notes: Billy emphasized the intensive creative problem-solving required to get the project completed, noting it was 'hard as hell' but successfully delivered. Edmond Yang commented it looked fun, to which Billy replied it was extremely challenging given the tight timeline.
tutorial.timeline: The entire project was completed over a weekend, from Thursday evening brief to Monday morning delivery.

items.title: üé® Jordan Daniel Chesney: Static Ad Creation Technique
items.overview: Jordan Daniel Chesney shares technique for creating viral static advertisements following the Javi Lopez rule.

tutorial.principle: Jordan created what he considered potentially his best static ad, which PJ Accetturo analyzed as following the Javi Lopez rule of viral content: must contain Food, Sex, and Danger, ideally all baked into one shot.
tutorial.technique: The approach focuses on combining multiple viral elements into a single compelling image that triggers multiple psychological responses simultaneously, increasing the likelihood of engagement and sharing.
key_elements: Food - Appeals to basic human needs and desires
Sex - Creates visual interest and emotional engagement
Danger - Adds tension and makes the image memorable
tutorial.application: Jordan noted the rules of virality 'coursing through my veins,' suggesting this approach has become second nature to his creative process. Rory Flynn and Edmond Yang both praised the result as 'excellent' and 'fire' respectively.
tutorial.best_practice: PJ emphasized that the best results come when all three elements are combined in a single shot rather than spread across multiple images.

items.title: üé¨ Billy Boman: P&G x Media Monks Commercial
items.overview: Billy Boman showcases P&G commercial adaptation for Middle East market featuring Egyptian celebrity, completed with Media Monks over a weekend.
items.description: Billy Boman shared a proof-of-concept project for P&G in the Middle East, created in collaboration with Media Monks. The project involved adapting an existing commercial featuring a female character into a version with an Egyptian male celebrity. The work required running some scenes through WAN while fully re-prompting others to accommodate the character change. The main technical challenge was handling two-shot scenes where a short female character needed to be replaced with a taller male character, which WAN couldn't properly handle due to composition and height differences. Despite the complexity, the project was completed over a weekend, with the brief received Thursday evening and delivery Monday morning. Edmond Yang called it fun, though Billy emphasized it was extremely challenging given the tight timeline.

items.title: üé® Jordan Daniel Chesney: Viral Static Advertisement
items.overview: Jordan Daniel Chesney creates potentially his best static ad, praised for following viral content principles.
items.description: Jordan Daniel Chesney shared what he considered potentially the best static ad he's ever created. PJ Accetturo analyzed it as perfectly following the Javi Lopez rule of viral content, which states that viral things must contain Food, Sex, and Danger, with the best results when all three elements are baked into one shot. Jordan joked about the rules of virality 'coursing through my veins.' Rory Flynn called it excellent, and Edmond Yang praised it as fire.

items.title: üé• Ludovic: WAN 2.6 Multi-Shot Demo
items.overview: Ludovic demonstrates WAN 2.6's one-prompt multi-shot capabilities with 15-second text-to-video generation.
items.description: Ludovic shared his first test of WAN 2.6's one-prompt multi-shot text-to-video capabilities, generating a 15-second sequence that maintained consistency across multiple shots without manual editing. The demonstration showcased the significant improvements in WAN's ability to handle complex, multi-shot narratives in a single generation.

items.title: üé¨ Ludovic: Seedance 1.5 Cinematic Test
items.overview: Ludovic demonstrates Seedance 1.5 Pro with complex single-generation cinematic scene featuring dialogue and environmental effects.
items.description: Ludovic shared his first text-to-video test with Seedance 1.5, creating a single-generation cinematic scene with over-the-shoulder alternating perspectives, intimate medium close-up shots with shallow depth of field, featuring two people under a flickering streetlight in a rainy parking lot. The prompt included tense spoken English dialogue, subtle footsteps, rain patter, low ambient city hum, soft dramatic top lighting, long shadows, reflective highlights, and emotionally charged cinematic drama style with no subtitles. The test demonstrated Seedance 1.5's ability to handle extremely complex prompts with multiple simultaneous elements in a single generation. Albert Bozesan asked if it was a single generation or edited clips, to which Ludovic confirmed it was a single text-to-video generation.

items.title: üé• Ryan Phillips: Historical Photo Recreation
items.overview: Ryan Phillips shares old photo recreation work.
items.description: Ryan Phillips shared work recreating an old photo, demonstrating techniques for historical image restoration and recreation using AI tools.

items.title: üé¨ Jordan Daniel Chesney: Daily Generation Showcase

items.description: Jordan Daniel Chesney shared video work with the caption 'One of them days, innit,' showcasing his daily creative output and maintaining his consistent presence in the community as a prolific creator.

items.description: Edmond Yang shared creative video work with an enthusiastic emoji, contributing to the community's ongoing showcase of daily creative output and experimentation with new tools and techniques.

items.overview: Stephan Bugaj joins the community, added by Justin Hackney.
items.description: Justin Hackney added Stephan Bugaj to RealDreams HQ on December 19, 2024. The community welcomed the new member to the dreamers.

items.title: üéôÔ∏è Justin Hackney: Livestream Fireside Chat Opportunity
items.overview: Justin Hackney announces plans for livestream fireside chats with RealDreams HQ creators, seeking participants.
items.description: Justin Hackney announced plans to launch livestream fireside chat sessions with RealDreams HQ creators, starting with a testing ground session for the Wonder Film Festival winner. He explained the goal is to master the process so they can start featuring the best creators in the space for deep conversations ranging from creative work and process to broader topics like the singularity. Jordan Daniel Chesney inquired if the first stream was just for winners or public, and Justin clarified the first is for the winner but future streams would feature other elite creators from the community. He created a poll asking who would be interested in participating, which received 18 yes votes and 3 humorous no votes. Edmond Yang, Aaron Bhugobaun, Rory Flynn, Billy Boman, Martin LeBlanc, and Chad Nelson all expressed interest in participating. Justin emphasized he would be honored to host these conversations and go deep down the rabbit hole with the community's top creators.

items.title: üöÄ Coordinated Model Release Day Discussion
items.overview: Winston Mayo and community discuss the humorous coincidence of five major models releasing on the same day.
items.description: Winston Mayo humorously observed that everyone thinking it was safe to release on December 16th resulted in five different models launching simultaneously (WAN 2.6, Seedance 1.5 Pro, Flux 2 Max, Kling voice control, and Meta's new model). The community found the coordination hilarious, noting how the AI industry seems to move in synchronized waves with major announcements often clustering together. This sparked discussion about competitive dynamics and release timing strategies in the rapidly evolving AI tools market.

items.title: üîß AI Infrastructure Reliability Discussion
items.overview: Albert Bozesan discusses widespread AI provider outages and infrastructure issues.
items.description: Albert Bozesan expressed frustration about what appeared to be widespread issues with AI providers over a 24-hour period, noting that RunComfy was completely down (couldn't load the page in Germany, could access homepage from US but couldn't launch). He suspected Cloudflare was the culprit, stating 'It's always fkn Cloudflare.' This sparked discussion about the fragility of AI infrastructure and the dependency on centralized services like Cloudflare for content delivery and DDoS protection. The conversation highlighted how infrastructure issues can cascade across multiple AI platforms simultaneously, affecting professional workflows.

items.title: üé® AI VFX Hybrid Workflows Discussion
items.overview: Billy Boman shares impressive AI VFX breakdown demonstrating hybrid creativity approaches.
items.description: Billy Boman shared a very cool AI VFX breakdown by Nitch Hiltgen, showcasing advanced hybrid workflows that combine AI generation with traditional VFX techniques. The breakdown demonstrated how professional creators are integrating AI tools into established production pipelines rather than replacing traditional methods entirely. This represents the evolving approach to AI in professional production environments, where AI serves as one tool among many rather than a complete replacement for traditional techniques.

items.title: üéµ Creative Workflow Music Recommendations
items.overview: Jordan Daniel Chesney shares music recommendation for working sessions.
items.description: Jordan Daniel Chesney shared a Spotify track recommendation, noting it as 'an excellent song to work to.' While slightly off-topic, this represents the community's culture of sharing not just technical knowledge but also the broader creative environment and practices that support sustained creative work. The recommendation reflects how professional creators think holistically about their working conditions and creative state.
